entity.description:
Payment application to settle payments and invoices. Can be used for multiple scenarios using different fields:
1. Apply a Payment (paymentId) to an Invoice (invoiceId) 2. Apply a Payment (paymentId) such as a refund to another Payment (toPaymentId) such as an invoice payment 3. Apply an Invoice (invoiceId) such as a Credit Memo payable to another Invoice (toInvoiceId) such as a Sales/Purchase receivable
In all cases the two opposing records should have reverse from/to party IDs.
To constrain to these three scenarios if toPaymentId is set paymentId should always be set, and if toInvoiceId is set invoiceId should always be set.

field.name: parentMarketSegmentId
field.description:
NOTE: this description is for the intended application of parentMarketSegmentId, actual behavior depends on code and could vary
A MarketSegment tree is a dependency tree with bi-directional dependencies so that any node in the tree can be evaluated for membership by a Party while being able to configure segment factors at any level of the tree and have them apply to all levels of a branch of the tree.
To implement this the general rule is that a Party is a member of a MarketSegment if all factors of that MarketSegment match, and the factors of the parent MarketSegment match (if there is one), and the factors of at least one child segment all match (if there is at least one child segment).
For example if segment A has two child segments A-1 and A-2, then a Party is in A if all factors of A match AND they are a member of either sub-segment A-1 or sub-segment A-2. A Party is in A-2 if all factors of A-2 match, and all factors of A match.

field.description: Set this when copying content from one Party to another, may have same or different contentLocation

field.name: relationshipName
field.description: Official name of relationship, such as title in an organization.

relationship.description: This is one-nofk because settingValue may by an enumId or may be plain text depending on PartySettingType
This is one-nofk because settingValue may by an enumId or may be plain text depending on PartySettingType

field.name: validRegexp
field.description: For non-enum settings, regexp to validate

field.name: templateAgreementId
field.description: The template agreement this agreement was cloned from

entity.description: For price lists associated with an AgreementItem use the ProducePrice entity.

field.name: paymentFraudEvidenceId
field.description: Refer to evidence here if trustLevelEnumId is gray listed or black listed

field.name: replacesContactMechId
field.description: For update by copy-on-write this is the ID of the ContactMech it replaces

entity.description: For configurable time periods used in accounting, sales quotas, etc.

field.name: partyId
field.description: The Party that owns the TimePeriod, generally an Internal Organization.

field.name: fromDate
field.description: The first day of the period.

field.name: thruDate
field.description: The last day of the period.

field.name: ownerPartyId
field.description: Brand or other organization that owns the product design, IP, etc. There may be multiple suppliers, manufacturers, etc for a product but only one that 'owns' it.

field.name: chargeShipping
field.description: Set to N to not charge shipping (ie defaults to Y)

field.name: taxable
field.description: Set to N to not charge sales tax (ie defaults to Y)

field.name: taxCode
field.description: A code representing the tax category of the product, passed to the tax calculation gateway.

field.name: amountFixed
field.description: For products with fixed amounts such as gift certificate amounts, rope lengths, etc.

field.name: amountRequire
field.description: Require an amount in addition to quantity on orders/etc.

field.name: productFeatureId
field.description: For virtual products to limit images/etc displayed by selectable feature, if null always display

field.name: productStoreId
field.description: For content limited to a specific store

entity.description: WARNING: to be deprecated by mantle.product.ProductUomDimension
WARNING: to be deprecated by moqui.basic.UomDimensionType
Used to specify relevant GL Accounts for a Product (expense, revenue, etc); not related to posting conf
Parameters for personalization and other information to track with purchase of Product

field.name: uomDimensionTypeId
field.description: Optional dimension type

field.name: productIdTypeEnumId
field.description: Optional product ID type

field.name: productId
field.description: Optional, if null option applies to all products that use the ProductParameter

field.name: productUomDimensionId
field.description: For options associated with a ProductUomDimension

field.name: productOtherIdentId
field.description: For options associated with a ProductOtherIdentification

entity.description: Used to group a set of parameter values for reference by single ID used on OrderItem, etc

field.name: marketSegmentId
field.description: Specify if parameterValue is based on customer's inclusion in a MarketSegment

field.name: productParameterOptionId
field.description: For values that come from a ProductParameterOption

field.name: productStoreId
field.description: For pricing per store. Leave null to apply to all stores.

field.name: vendorPartyId
field.description: For sales from internal organization (ie company) set to internal organization's ID. For supplier prices set to supplier's ID.

field.name: customerPartyId
field.description: For general consumer prices leave null. For a price for a specific customer (or group of customers), set to that customer's ID. For supplier prices this is the internal organization's (ie company's) ID.

field.name: termUomId
field.description: For recurring and usage prices to specify a time/freq measure, or a usage unit measure (bits, minutes, etc).

field.name: taxInPrice
field.description: If Y the price field has tax included for the given taxAuthorityId at the taxPercentage.

field.name: agreementItemSeqId
field.description: Use along with agreementId to associate the price with an AgreementItem.

field.name: serviceRegisterId
field.description: Registered Service of type ProductPriceModify that implements the mantle.product.PriceServices.modify#ProductPrice interface

entity.description: Configure tasks (WorkEffort) that will be cloned when Product is ordered and associated with OrderItem using OrderItemWorkEffort.

field.name: requiredWork
field.description: If Y require WorkEffort Status of Complete, Closed, or Cancelled to consider OrderItem fulfilled

field.name: cloneOnStatusId
field.description: OrderPart or OrderHeader status when the WorkEffort should be cloned and associated with the corresponding OrderItem with an OrderItemWorkEffort record

field.name: forStatusId
field.description: Task must be Complete or Closed before change to this order status (soft rule, depending on code in place)

field.name: productId
field.description: The Asset is an Instance of this Product (for inventory, maintenance schedules/etc, content about what sort of thing the Asset is, etc)

field.name: hasQuantity
field.description: If Y asset has a quantity and QOH/ATP may be greater than one. If N (default) asset is a single item and may have a serial number, etc.

field.name: originalQuantityUomId
field.description: QOHT and ATPT are in units of the Product (amountUomId). This field specifies the original UOM (along with originalQuantity) when it differs from Product.amountUomId.

field.name: facilityId
field.description: Current Facility, where stored.

field.name: containerId
field.description: Container stored in, if specified the current facilityId and locationSeqId should come from the container and not from this record or with standard EECA rule in place facilityId and locationSeqId will be set and maintained from the Container values.

field.name: originId
field.description: Origin ID, the ID used wherever this came from.

field.name: originFacilityId
field.description: Origin Facility, where manufactured or came from.

field.name: acquireWorkEffortId
field.description: For assets created from production runs, etc.

field.name: depreciation
field.description: History in AssetDepreciation

field.name: yearBeginDepreciation
field.description: History in AssetDepreciation

entity.description: Used to specify relevant GL Accounts for an Asset (expense, revenue, etc); not related to posting conf

field.name: serialNumber
field.description: Serial number or license plate for the container.

field.name: externalId
field.description: An identifier for the container in an external system (source, origin, etc).

field.name: productStoreId
field.description: For content limited to a specific store

entity.description: Based on mantle.product.ProductOtherIdentification to be a one ProductCategory to many ProductCategoryIdent.

field.name: featureProductId
field.description: For Optional features represented by a Product (lightweight product configuration)

field.name: quantityNotAvailable
field.description: The quantity not available to promise for this reservation (corresponds to negative Asset.availableToPromiseTotal).

field.name: quantityNotIssued
field.description: The quantity not yet issued.

field.name: productMaintenanceId
field.description: Optional, though should be filled in to determine upcoming maintenance for all scheduled maintenance

field.name: intervalUomId
field.description: UOM for intervalQuantity; ignored if intervalProductMeterId is used

entity.description: This is used to specify the details for scheduled maintenance.

field.name: templateWorkEffortId
field.description: Template of Maintenance Plan. WorkEffort may have WorkEffortAssoc records for tasks/breakdown details.

field.name: intervalUomId
field.description: UOM for intervalQuantity; ignored if intervalProductMeterId is used

field.name: repeatCount
field.description: If 0 or null means no limit to repeat count; can be used with multiple ProductMaintenance records for a single MaintenanceType in cases where maintenance intervals are not evenly distributed, or only need to be done once like a break-in period

field.name: defaultUomId
field.description: This is optional and if applicable can describe the meter better

field.name: organizationPartyId
field.description: The Organization Party that Orders, Invoices, GL transactions, etc will be associated with.

field.name: returnPostalContactMechId
field.description: Return postal address for shipping labels

field.name: shipmentAnyCarrierMethod
field.description: If Y don't restrict Shipment Shipping Options by ProductStoreShipOption records during fulfillment, show all Shipment Methods for Carriers associated with shipping gateway

field.name: insurancePackageThreshold
field.description: If total cost of items in a package is above this amount buy insurance on that package

field.name: autoApproveDelay
field.description: Minimum time in minutes to wait before trying to auto-approve; defaults to 0 which means auto-approve immediately (via SECA rule), otherwise delayed auto-approve handled with service job

field.name: storeDomain
field.description: Store domain for use in emails

field.name: profileUrlPath
field.description: Path to profile page for use in emails

field.name: wikiSpaceId
field.description: For a WikiSpace mounted as content, superceded by ProductStoreWikiSpace with spaceTypeEnumId=PstFull

field.name: contentDataDocumentId
field.description: Warning: this field to be deprecated in favor of a ProductStoreDataDocument entity with a typeEnumId of PsdtContent. The dataDocumentId to use for search of content pages in wikiSpaceId

field.name: blogDataDocumentId
field.description: Warning: this field to be deprecated in favor a ProductStoreDataDocument entity with a typeEnumId of PsdtBlog. The dataDocumentId to use for search of blog entries

field.name: productDataDocumentId
field.description: Warning: this field to be deprecated in favor of a ProductStoreDataDocument entity with a typeEnumId of PsdtProduct. The dataDocumentId to use for product search

field.name: systemMessageRemoteId
field.description: Reference to the SystemMessageRemote record for the remote system this store is for such as a separate, integrated ecommerce app. Note that SystemMessageRemote is extended with a productStoreId so that other SystemMessageRemotes know which store they are for (if applicable).

entity.description: For per-store configurable pre-approve order validations

field.name: serviceRegisterId
field.description: Registered Service of type OrderValidate that implements the mantle.order.OrderInfoServices.validate#Order interface

entity.description: Relationship between the ProductStore and DataDocument Entities meant to replace ProductStore.productDataDocumentId fields and the like. See: https://forum.moqui.org/t/productstore-datadocument-options/303.

field.name: itemDescription
field.description: Description for the OrderItem (itemDescription), promo service should run this through ResourceFacade.expand() with parameters depending on the promo service

field.name: serviceRegisterId
field.description: Registered Service of type ProductStorePromotion that implements the mantle.product.StoreServices.apply#Promotion interface

moqui.basic.Enumeration.description: Order Approve Warn New Customer (false to disable)
Order Approve Warn Address not Valid (false to disable)
Order Approve Warn Address Missing (false to disable)
Order Approve Warn Large Order - Total Above (default 0, 0 to disable)
Order Approve Warn Large Web Order - Total Above (default 0, 0 to disable)
Order Approve Warn Std Devs Over Avg Total (default 3.0, 0 to disable)
Order Approve Warn Std Devs Over Avg Product Qty (default 3.0, 0 to disable)
Order Approve Warn Inventory Not Available (false to disable)
Order Approve Warn Percent Available Inventory (default 20, 0 to disable)
Order Approve Warn Similar within 24hrs (false to disable)
Order Approve Warn Price Min/Max (false to disable)
Order Approve Warn Billing and Shipping Addresses Differ (false to disable)
Order Approve Warn Payment Method Name Differs (false to disable)
Order Approve Warn Contact Mech Grey/Blacklisted (false to disable)

field.name: billingType
field.description: For third party and other carrier account billing; for Shippo valid values are SENDER, RECIPIENT, THIRD_PARTY

field.name: billingAccount
field.description: Third party or other carrier account number

field.name: billingCountry
field.description: For Shippo this is the 2 letter ISO country code

field.name: insurancePercent
field.description: For insurance estimate records the percent of insured amount that is the cost of the insurance

entity.description: Used to configure the wiki space type and page path given a store content type. An alternative to directly specifying the spaceTypeEnumId (for ProductStoreWikiSpace) and pagePath for lookup within the WikiSpace.
Used to configure a WikiSpace to use for a given store, space type, and locale instead of directly referencing a wikiSpaceId.

field.name: resourceInstanceId
field.description: ID of an instance of a resource, like a serial number or executing instance ID.

field.name: initServiceName
field.description: Service called when a new subscription to a resource begins. Must implement the mantle.product.SubscriptionServices.init#SubscriptionResource service interface.

field.name: renewServiceName
field.description: Service called when an existing subscription is renewed. Can be empty or do nothing, using revoke after expire instead. Must implement the mantle.product.SubscriptionServices.renew#SubscriptionResource service interface.

field.name: revokeAccessServiceName
field.description: Service called when inactive subscription goes past revokeAccessTime. Must implement the mantle.product.SubscriptionServices.revoke#SubscriptionResourceAccess service interface.

field.name: restoreAccessServiceName
field.description: Service called on special events (manual or otherwise) to resore access. Must implement the mantle.product.SubscriptionServices.restore#SubscriptionResourceAccess service interface.

field.name: destroyServiceName
field.description: Service called when inactive subscription goes past destroyTime. Must implement the mantle.product.SubscriptionServices.destroy#SubscriptionResource service interface.

field.name: emailContactMechId
field.description: Where to send the results of the request.

field.name: responsiblePartyId
field.description: Party (person or group) responsible for Requests in this Category.

field.name: selectedAmount
field.description: When Product.amountRequire=Y the amount goes here to supplement the quantity.

field.name: maximumAmount
field.description: The maximum amount (price) to pay for the item.

entity.description: Associate orders (including proposed/quote orders) with an opportunity

field.name: binLocationNumber
field.description: For picking multiple shipments in a single shipment load (shipWorkEffortId, with purpose Shipment Load/Ship, WepShipmentShip); this is the structure for a picklist instead of having a separate Picklist entity. This may be overridden within a Shipment with the field of the same name on ShipmentItemSource.

field.name: priority
field.description: Numeric priority, 1 to 9 where 1 is highest priority and 9 is lowest priority (like a to do list), defaults to 5

field.name: pickContainerId
field.description: Container assigned for picking, to move Asset(s) to Container on pick and issue from Container on pack

field.name: externalId
field.description: ID for the shipment in the direct upstream system it came from if it came from an external system

field.name: originId
field.description: ID for the shipment in the original system it came from if not the direct upstream system

field.name: defaultGrossWeight
field.description: For flat rate boxes up to a certain weight, used if there is no ShipmentPackage.weight

field.name: binLocationNumber
field.description: This overrides the corresponding Shipment.binLocationNumber so that a shipment may be split across picklist bins, such as when one bin per order on the shipment is needed.

field.name: insuranceAmount
field.description: Usually an estimate: insuredAmount * (ProductStoreShippingGateway.insurancePercent/100)

field.name: scaCode
field.description: Standard Carrier Alpha Code

entity.description: Use to override gatewayBoxId on ShipmentBoxType

field.name: shippingGatewayTypeEnumId
field.description: Each shipping gateway integration should define a ShippingGatewayType Enumeration record plus an entity with a shared PK (ie PK is shippingGatewayConfigId).

field.name: getOrderRateServiceName
field.description: Service implementing mantle.shipment.CarrierServices.get#OrderShippingRate interface.

field.name: getShippingRatesBulkName
field.description: Service implementing mantle.shipment.CarrierServices.get#ShippingRatesBulk interface.

field.name: getAutoPackageInfoName
field.description: Service implementing mantle.shipment.CarrierServices.get#AutoPackageInfo interface.

field.name: getRateServiceName
field.description: Service implementing mantle.shipment.CarrierServices.get#ShippingRate interface.

field.name: requestLabelsServiceName
field.description: Service implementing mantle.shipment.CarrierServices.request#ShippingLabels interface.

field.name: refundLabelsServiceName
field.description: Service implementing mantle.shipment.CarrierServices.refund#ShippingLabels interface.

field.name: trackLabelsServiceName
field.description: Service implementing mantle.shipment.CarrierServices.track#ShippingLabels interface.

field.name: validateAddressServiceName
field.description: Service implementing mantle.shipment.CarrierServices.validate#ShippingPostalAddress interface.

mantle.shipment.carrier.ShippingGatewayC.description: Local gateway for order shipping rate

entity.description: Use to override gatewayServiceCode on CarrierShipmentMethod

field.name: parentWorkEffortId
field.description: For task/etc breakdown

field.name: rootWorkEffortId
field.description: The root of the tree this is part of (if applicable), like a project

field.name: ownerPartyId
field.description: The party that "owns" the work effort, for production runs producing inventory this will be used as the Asset.ownerPartyId

field.name: facilityId
field.description: Where the WorkEffort takes place

field.name: shipmentMethodEnumId
field.description: Mostly for Shipment Load/Ship (WepShipmentShip) purpose, using WorkEffort as a more task and planning oriented approach to a picklist.

field.name: allDayEnd
field.description: Can be null for single day events

field.name: estimatedWorkTime
field.description: Total estimated work time across all parties

field.name: estimatedSetupTime
field.description: Total estimated setup time across all parties

field.name: remainingWorkTime
field.description: Total remaining work time across all parties

field.name: actualWorkTime
field.description: Total actual work time across all parties

field.name: actualSetupTime
field.description: Total actual setup time across all parties

field.name: totalTimeAllowed
field.description: Total work time allowed (budgeted) across all parties

field.name: estimatedWorkDuration
field.description: Estimated work duration in calendar time (see estimatedWorkTime for total worked time across parties)

field.name: actualWorkDuration
field.description: Actual work duration in calendar time (see actualWorkTime for total worked time across parties)

field.name: actualBreakDuration
field.description: Actual break duration in calendar time

field.name: timeUomId
field.description: Time unit for all time and duration fields; defaults to hours (TF_hr)

moqui.basic.StatusFlow.description: Other, more lenient, status transitions for WorkEffort

entity.description: For equipment, inventory, etc needed in the work effort.
Categories for WorkEffort, especially events like iCal/VCALENDAR categories

field.name: partyId
field.description: The party performing work (worker, may be the vendor or work for the vendor)

field.name: vendorPartyId
field.description: The vendor (employer, etc) who pays the worker. With workEffortId (task or project) the party in the Vendor role, with facilityId the party in the Manager role

field.name: clientPartyId
field.description: The client who pays the vendor for bill through. May get through timesheetId, workEffortId (with Customer or CustomerBillTo role), or facilityId (Facility.ownerPartyId)

field.name: hasModifiedRates
field.description: Set to Y when *Rate fields are manually set and not from RateAmount lookups

field.name: rateAmountId
field.description: Client/customer hourly RateAmount reference

field.name: vendorRateAmountId
field.description: Vendor/worker hourly RateAmount reference

field.name: breakHours
field.description: Non-paid break hours e.g. Lunch

field.name: pieceRateAmountId
field.description: Client/customer piece RateAmount reference

field.name: vendorPieceRateAmountId
field.description: Vendor/worker piece RateAmount reference

field.name: facilityId
field.description: Where the work was done; if null and workEffortId is set get from WorkEffort.facilityId

field.name: memberInfo
field.description: General info about the member, usage is specific to the enum group

field.name: optionValue
field.description: Usage depends on enum type such as an ID format/mask

field.name: optionIndicator
field.description: Indicator flag with meaning depending on enum type

field.name: statusTypeId
field.description: Optional. If specified uses status items with this type.

field.name: isInitial
field.description: If true can be an initial status in this flow.

field.name: conditionExpression
field.description: Not currently supported, may be removed, issue with what is the context for the expression

relationship.description: No FK in order to allow arbitrary permissions (ie not pre-configured).

field.name: conversionOffset
field.description: The factor is multiplied first, then the offset is added. When converting in the reverse direction the offset is subtracted first, then divided by the factor.

field.name: rootEmailMessageId
field.description: For threaded messages, this points to the message that started the thread.

field.name: parentEmailMessageId
field.description: For threaded messages, this points to the previous message in the thread.

field.name: bodyText
field.description: The plain text variation of the body

field.name: emailTemplateId
field.description: For outgoing messages that came from an EmailTemplate.

field.name: storeFolder
field.description: Defaults to INBOX

field.name: allowedToDomains
field.description: Comma separated list of domain names to allow (like: moqui.org, dejc.com), matched by ends with; if no value specified all domains allowed

field.name: replyToAddresses
field.description: Comma separated list of reply to email addresses

field.name: ccAddresses
field.description: Comma separated list of CC email addresses

field.name: bccAddresses
field.description: Comma separated list of BCC email addresses

field.name: attachmentLocation
field.description: ResourceFacade location for attachment content or screen (if screenRenderMode specified)

field.name: screenPath
field.description: Alternative to attachmentLocation as a location for the screen rendered on its own. If specified is used to determine the screen by path from the root screen looked up using the webappName and webHostName values from EmailTemplate.

field.name: screenRenderMode
field.description:
Used to determine the MIME/content type, and which screen render template to use. Can be used to generate XSL:FO that is transformed to a PDF and attached to the email with screenRenderMode=xsl-fo.
If empty the content at attachmentLocation will be sent over without rendering and its MIME type will be based on its extension.

field.name: forEachIn
field.description: A Groovy expression that evaluates to a Collection in the context to iterate over and add an attachment for each. If entries are Map objects puts all entries in context for each (pushed/isolated context), otherwise puts Collection entry in 'forEachEntry' field. Only applicable if screenRenderMode is specified so that there is a render of the attachment.

field.name: attachmentCondition
field.description: Optional Groovy expression evaluated as a boolean, if specified and evaluates to false attachment will be skipped.

field.name: serverPort
field.description: Defaults to 631

field.name: printerName
field.description: Leave empty to use default printer on print server

field.name: dataDocumentId
field.description: For ElasticSearch compatibility, and as a general good practice for use as a dynamic view-entity, must follow entity name convention of camel case and starting with a capital letter.

field.name: documentName
field.description: The name of the document for display in search results and such. Is generally expanded on display and may use any field in the DataDocument.

field.name: documentTitle
field.description: A title for each document instance for display in search results or other places. Meant to be string expanded using a "flattened" version of the document (see the CollectionUtilities.flattenNestedMap() method).

field.name: indexName
field.description: This should be specified for documents that will be indexed by ElasticSearch and must be lower-case (ElasticSearch requires all lower-case). Because of changes in ElasticSearch 5 this is no longer the actual index name and is instead an alias for each index from a DataDocument.

field.name: manualDataServiceName
field.description: Name of a service to call to get additional data to include in the document. This service should implement the org.moqui.EntityServices.add#ManualDocumentData interface.

field.name: manualMappingServiceName
field.description: Name of a service to call to alter the generated elasticsearch mapping for the data document. This service should implement the org.moqui.EntityServices.transform#DocumentMapping interface.

entity.description: This is a very simple sort of condition to constrain data document output.

field.name: operator
field.description: Must be a valid value like those in the econdition.@operator attribute. Ignored if postQuery=Y. Defaults (like that attribute) to 'equals'.

field.name: postQuery
field.description: If Y condition is applied after the query is done instead of being added to the query as a condition. Must match at least one nested field with the specified fieldNameAlias. The fieldValue String will be compared to the Object from the database field after conversion using the Groovy asType() method.

field.name: fieldPath
field.description:
String formatted like "RelationshipName:RelationshipName:fieldName" with zero or more relationship names. If there is no relationship name the field is on the primary entity. More than one relationship names means follow that path of relationships to get to the field.
This may also contain a Groovy expression using other fields in the current Map/Object in the document by the path or any parent Map/Object above it in the document. When an expression is used a fieldNameAlias is required.

field.name: fieldNameAlias
field.description: Alias to put in document output for field name (ie final part of fieldPath only). Defaults to final part of fieldPath. Must be unique within the document and can be used in EntityCondition passed into the EntityFacade.findDataDocuments() method.

field.name: fieldType
field.description: The ElasticSearch field type to use, default is based on entity field type or for expression fields defaults to 'double'.

field.name: sortable
field.description: Indicates the field should be sortable. This is needed because in ElasticSearch we have two string types to work with: text (tokenized for search, not sortable) and keyword (sortable but not tokenized for search). In ElasticSearch this adds [field name].keyword field of type keyword to sort on if the entity field is a 'text' type ElasticSearch field.

field.name: defaultDisplay
field.description: Fields displayed by default, set to N to not display in output.

field.name: functionName
field.description: If specific the field is queried with the given function. Must be one of the functions available in the view-entity.alias.@function attribute.

entity.description: Associate links with a DataDocument to use in applications for links to details, edit screens, etc for search results.

field.name: urlType
field.description: Must match an option for the XML Screen link.@url-type attribute. Defaults to 'plain'.

field.name: relationshipName
field.description: The name of a relationship used in any fieldPath to be aliased in the output document.

field.name: documentAlias
field.description: Alias to put in document output instead of the full relationship name.

entity.description: Use this entity to allow a user group access to the DataDocument (for reports, etc). For all users use userGroupId="ALL_USERS".

field.name: indexOnStartEmpty
field.description: If Y index the feed on start if the index does not yet exist (for servers where ES data not persisted between restarts)

field.name: feedReceiveServiceName
field.description: The service named here should implement the org.moqui.EntityServices.receive#DataFeed interface; defaults in some cases to 'org.moqui.search.SearchServices.index#DataDocuments'

field.name: feedDeleteServiceName
field.description: The service named here should implement the org.moqui.EntityServices.receive#DataFeedDelete interface; defaults in some cases to 'org.moqui.search.SearchServices.delete#DataDocument'

field.name: lastFeedStamp
field.description: Used only for periodic feeds.

field.name: recordThreshold
field.description: Keep retrieving time splits until the number of records is greater then this threshold.

field.name: delayBufferMillis
field.description: Newer retrieve records newer than this many milliseconds in the past (leave a delay buffer for transactions in progress).

field.name: targetPath
field.description: For sending to via file the path and filename to use, or path/filename pattern using Groovy string expand

field.name: forPull
field.description: If Y this record tracks data pulled from a remote system, otherwise it tracks data pushed from this system.

entity.description: Associates a set of entities through ArtifactGroupMember records associated with an ArtifactGroup. ArtifactGroupMember records may have filterMap value and may have nameIsPattern=Y. The filterMap is ignored when the application type is Exclude, it simply excludes the entity altogether. To exclude records use a filterMap on an include. If there are multiple ArtifactGroupMember records with filterMap value for an entity it will OR them together. If include and exclude filters create condition with combined include AND NOT combined exclude.

field.name: artifactGroupId
field.description: Only entity artifacts (artifactTypeEnumId=AT_ENTITY) will be used, all others ignored.

field.name: dependents
field.description: If Y also include dependents of records, will apply to all records for applicable entities.

field.name: fieldName
field.description: The name of the field corresponding to the joinFromAlias.

field.name: relatedFieldName
field.description: The name of the field corresponding to the entityAlias, ie the related field.

field.name: exampleId
field.description: primary sequenced ID

field.name: exampleFeatureId
field.description: primary sequenced ID

field.name: exampleItemSeqId
field.description: secondary sequenced ID

entity.description: Currency Dimension. The natural key is [currencyId]
Date Day Dimension. The natural key is [dateValue]

field.name: yearMonthDay
field.description: Format: YYYY-MM-DD

field.name: yearAndMonth
field.description: Format: YYYY-MM

entity.description: Each record represents a single blog article, grouped as needed by categories (WikiBlogCategory)

field.name: sentDate
field.description: The date/time a blog post within a category was sent by email or other means.

field.name: docIndex
field.description: Part of the key (used to reference within a screen) and for sort order

entity.description: For scheduled screen renders to send by email and/or write to a resource location. Primarily intended for use on report screens with a form-list and saved-finds enabled, referencing the formListFindId for saved columns, parameters, etc.

field.name: renderMode
field.description: Defaults to 'csv', can also use 'xsl-fo' with PDF rendering, 'xlsx' if moqui-poi component in place

field.name: noResultsAbort
field.description: Set to Y to abort (not send or write) if there are no results in form-list on screen

field.name: saveToLocation
field.description: Expandable String for resource location to save to, only save to location if specified

field.name: emailTemplateId
field.description: EmailTemplate to use to send by email, generally of type EMT_SCREEN_RENDER, for default use the Default Screen Render template (set to 'SCREEN_RENDER'); only sends email if specified

field.name: userId
field.description: Send email to UserAccount.emailAddress for the user

field.name: userGroupId
field.description: Send email to UserAccount.emailAddress for each user in the group

entity.description: Runtime data for a scheduled ServiceJob (with a cronExpression), managed automatically by the service job runner.

field.name: resourceValue
field.description: The location, name or other value description the resource.

field.name: userGroupId
field.description: DEPRECATED. While still supported, to control access to subscreens use ArtifactAuthz and related records instead.

field.name: menuTitle
field.description: The title to show for this subscreen in the menu. Can be used to override subscreen titles in the screen.default-menu-title attribute and the subscreens-item.menu-title attribute.

field.name: menuIndex
field.description: Insert this item in subscreens menu at this index (1-based).

field.name: menuInclude
field.description: Defaults to Y. Set to N to not include in the menu for the subscreens. This can be used to hide subscreens from the directory structure or even explicitly declared in the Screen XML file.

field.name: makeDefault
field.description: If Y will be set at the default subscreen (replacing screen.subscreens.@default-item)

field.name: noSubPath
field.description: If Y the sub-screens of the sub-screen may be referenced directly under this screen, skipping the screen path element for the sub-screen

field.name: modifyXmlScreenForm
field.description: The screen location and form name (separated by a hash/pound sign) of XML Screen Form to modify.

field.name: condition
field.description: Only show this field if the condition evaluates to true (Groovy expression)

field.name: fieldTypeEnumId
field.description: Field type for presentation, validation; always stored as plain text FormResponseAnswer

field.name: printPageNumber
field.description: Defaults to 1, ie one page/section for all fields if nothing higher than 1 is specified.

entity.description: Used to provide attribute values. For a reference of attributes available for each field type, see the corresponding element in the xml-form-?.xsd file.

field.name: userGroupId
field.description: These settings are for a UserGroup. To apply to all users just use the ALL_USERS UserGroup.

field.name: positionIndex
field.description: The position (row for form-single, column for form-list) number to put the field in

field.name: positionSequence
field.description: The sequence within the row or column

entity.description: Structured to have a single FormConfig per form and user.
Structured to have a single FormConfig per form and user.
Has fields for the various options in search-form-inputs/searchFormInputs()/searchFormMap()
Per-User default FormListFind by screen location and not form location because must be handled very early in screen rendering so parameters are available to actions, etc
If an artifact in the group specified is accessed by any user in the AuthzGroup maxHitsCount times in maxHitsDuration seconds then the user/artifact will be blocked fir tarputDuration seconds.

field.name: authzServiceName
field.description: If specified this service will be called and it should return a authzTypeEnumId with the result of the authorization. Will try to pass the following fields to this service: userId, authzActionEnumId, artifactTypeEnumId, and artifactName. The service will also have access to the ArtifactExecutionFacade (ec.artifactExecution) which you can use to get the current artifact stack, etc. The service must return an authzTypeEnumId (AUTHZT_ALLOW, AUTHZT_ALWAYS, or AUTHZT_DENY).

relationship.description: No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.

field.name: applyCond
field.description: Groovy boolean (if) expression, if specified checked before applying filters in the set

field.name: artifactName
field.description: Full artifact location/name, or a pattern if nameIsPattern=Y.

field.name: inheritAuthz
field.description:
If Y then the user will have authorization for anything called by the artifact. If N user will need to have authorization for anything else called by the artifact.
Note that in some cases (like in screen-sets) inheritance in the other direction is on by default, or in other words permission to access an artifact implies permission to access everything needed to get to that artifact.
Defaults to Y.

field.name: filterMap
field.description: A Groovy expression that evaluates to a Map that will be used to constrain if the member is part of the group based on fields/parameters for Entity operations and Service calls.

entity.description: If an artifact in the group specified is accessed by any user in the UserGroup maxHitsCount times in maxHitsDuration seconds then the user/artifact will be blocked for tarpitDuration seconds.
Deny access to the artifact for the user until releaseDateTime is reached.

relationship.description: No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.

field.name: entityName
field.description: The name of the entity to filter when queried. May be queried directly or as part of a view-entity.

field.name: filterMap
field.description:
A Groovy expression that evaluates to a Map that will be added to queries to filter/constrain visible data. Values can be constants or variables that come from user context (ec.user.context) or execution context (ec.context). It is up to code to set values for use by these filters.
If the value evaluates to a Collection the default comparison operator is IN, otherwise default is EQUALS. If a Collection is empty results in a false constraint, unless using a NOT* comparison operator.

field.name: joinOr
field.description: If Y then OR filterMap entries, default AND.

field.name: applyCond
field.description: Groovy boolean (if) expression, if specified checked before applying filters in the set

field.name: allowMissingAlias
field.description: By default if a filterMap refers to a field not aliased in a view-entity there will be an error, set this to Y to do the query anyway

field.name: username
field.description: The username used along with the password to login

field.name: userFullName
field.description: User's first, middle, last, etc name

field.name: currentPassword
field.description: NOTE: not an encrypted field because one way hash encryption used for it

field.name: resetPassword
field.description: Set to random password for password reset, can be used only to update password

field.name: passwordBase64
field.description: Set to Y is currentPassword Base64 encoded, defaults to Hex encoded

field.name: publicKey
field.description: RSA public key for key based authentication

field.name: hasLoggedOut
field.description: Set to Y when user logs out and to N when user logs in. If user is session authenticated on request and this is Y then treat as if user not authenticated.

field.name: terminateDate
field.description: If set then user may not login after this date, and no notifications will be sent after this date.

field.name: emailAddress
field.description: The email address to use for forgot password emails and other system messages.

field.name: ipAllowed
field.description: If specified only allow login from matching IP4 address. Comma separated patterns where each pattern has 4 dot separated segments each segment may be number, '*' for wildcard, or '-' separate number range (like '0-31').

entity.description: This entity is for recording User Authentication Factors.

field.name: factorOption
field.description: Use varies based on factor type: TOTP is shared secret, Single Use is the code, Email Code is email address

relationship.description: No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.

field.name: ipAllowed
field.description: See UserAccout.ipAllowed

relationship.description: No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.
No FK in order to allow arbitrary permissions (ie not pre-configured).

entity.description: Use this entity for user group preferences (or properties). For all users use userGroupId="ALL_USERS".

field.name: groupPriority
field.description: For deciding which value to use when a user is a member of multiple groups with preferences with the same key.

relationship.description: No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.

relationship.title: UserPreferenceKey
relationship.description: No FK because any key can be used whether or not there is an Enumeration record for it.
No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.
No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.

entity.description: A login key is an alternate way to authenticate a user, generally issued for temporary use sort of like a session.

field.name: loginKey
field.description: NOTE: not an encrypted field because one way hash encryption used for it (uses login-key.@encrypt-hash-type, no salt, hash before lookup on verify)

relationship.description: No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.

entity.description: Use this entity for user-specific preferences (or properties). For default preferences use userId="_NA_".

relationship.description: No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.

relationship.title: UserPreferenceKey
relationship.description: No FK because any key can be used whether or not there is an Enumeration record for it.
No FK in order to allow externally authenticated users.

field.name: errorTitleTemplate
field.description: If populated used when type=danger

field.name: typeString
field.description: One of: info, success, warning, danger

field.name: isPrivate
field.description: If Y user must be associated to see it or receive notifications.

field.name: receiveNotifications
field.description: For each User if there is no NotificationTopicUser.receiveNotifications value then use this as the default, this defaults to N.

field.name: emailNotifications
field.description: For each User if there is no NotificationTopicUser.emailNotifications value then use this as the default, this defaults to N.

field.name: emailTemplateId
field.description: If is specified use this template to send a notification email to each user with emailNotifications=Y

field.name: receiveNotifications
field.description: If notification sent to user only actually notify if this is Y

field.name: allNotifications
field.description: If Y user receives all notifications on topic even if not sent directly

field.name: emailNotifications
field.description: If Y sends an email to user using UserAccount.emailAddress

field.name: artifactName
field.description: The name of the artifact hit. For XML Screen request it is "${webapp-name}.${screen-path}"

field.name: totalSquaredTime
field.description: Total (sum) of the squared running times for calculating incremental standard deviation.

field.name: slowHitCount
field.description: After 100 hits count of hits more that 2.6 standard deviations above average (both avg and std dev adjusted incrementally).

field.name: instanceAddress
field.description: If instance accesses DB by different address specify here

entity.description: For ad-hoc (explicitly run) or scheduled service jobs. If cronExpression is null the job will only be run ad-hoc, when explicitly called using ServiceCallJob. If a topic is specified results will be sent to the topic (can be configured using a NotificationTopic record) as a NotificationMessage to the user that called the job explicitly (if applicable) and to users associated with ServiceJobUser records.

field.name: topic
field.description: On completion send a notification to this topic

field.name: localOnly
field.description: If Y this will be run local only. By default runs on any server in a cluster listening for async distributed services (if an async distributed executor is configured).

field.name: cronExpression
field.description:
An extended cron expression like Unix crontab but with extended syntax options (L, W, etc) similar to Quartz Scheduler. See:
http://cron-parser.com http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.2.x/tutorials/tutorial-lesson-06.html

field.name: fromDate
field.description: Only run scheduled after this date/time. Ignored for ad-hoc/explicit runs.

field.name: thruDate
field.description: Only run scheduled before this date/time. Ignored for ad-hoc/explicit runs.

field.name: repeatCount
field.description: If specified only run this many times. Must specify a cronExpression for the job to repeat. When this count is reached thruDate will be set to now and paused set to Y. Ignored for ad-hoc/explicit runs.

field.name: paused
field.description: If Y this job is inactive and won't be run on a schedule even if cronExpression is not null. Ignored for ad-hoc/explicit runs.

field.name: expireLockTime
field.description: Ignore lock and run anyway after this many minutes. This should generally be much greater than the longest time the service is expected to run. This is the mechanism for recovering jobs after a run failed in a way that did not clean up the ServiceJobRunLock record. Defaults to 24 hours (1440 minutes) to make sure jobs get recovered.

field.name: minRetryTime
field.description: Minimum time between retries after an error (based on most recent ServiceJobRun record), in minutes

field.name: priority
field.description: Job execution priority, lower numbers run first among jobs that need to be run regardless of scheduled start time

entity.description: Parameters automatically added when the job service is called. Always stored as a String and will be converted based on the corresponding service in-parameter.parameter.@type attribute (just as with any service call).

field.name: userId
field.description: The user that initiated the job run

entity.description: Runtime data for a scheduled ServiceJob (with a cronExpression), managed automatically by the service job runner.

field.name: jobRunId
field.description: If not null this is the currently running job instance.

field.name: systemMessageRemoteId
field.description: Reference to the SystemMessageRemote record for the remote system this message came from for incoming messages or should be sent to for outgoing messages.

field.name: initDate
field.description: For incoming the received date, for outgoing the produced date

field.name: processedDate
field.description: For incoming the consumed date, for outgoing the sent date

field.name: parentMessageId
field.description: If a received message is split this is the original message

field.name: ackMessageId
field.description: The message received or sent to acknowledge this message

field.name: remoteMessageId
field.description: For messages to/from another Moqui system, the systemMessageId on the remote system; may also be used for other system level message IDs (as opposed to messageId which is for the ID in the envelope of the message)

field.name: senderId
field.description: ID of the sender (for OAGIS may be broken down into logicalId, component, task, referenceId; for EDI X12 this is ISA06)

field.name: receiverId
field.description: ID of the receiver (for OAGIS may also be broken down; for EDI X12 this is ISA08)

field.name: messageId
field.description: ID of the message; this may be globally unique (like the OAGIS BODID, a GUID) or only unique relative to the senderId and the receiverId (like EDI X12 ISA13 in the context of ISA06, ISA08), and may only be unique within a certain time period (ID may be reused since in EDI X12 limited to 9 digits)

field.name: messageDate
field.description: Date/time from message (for EDI X12 this is GS04 (date) and GS05 (time))

field.name: docType
field.description: For OAGIS the BSR Noun; For X12 GS01 (functional ID code)

field.name: docSubType
field.description: For OAGIS the BSR Verb; For X12 ST01 (tx set ID code)

field.name: docControl
field.description: Control number of the message when applicable (such as GS06 in EDI X12 messages)

field.name: docSubControl
field.description: Sub-Control number of the message when applicable (such as ST02 in EDI X12 messages)

field.name: docVersion
field.description: The document version (for OAGIS BSR Revision, for X12 GS08 (version/revision))

field.name: triggerVisitId
field.description: Active visit when SystemMessage triggered (mainly produced) to track the user who did so; independent of the message transport which could have separate remote system and other Visit-like data.

entity.description: For runtime configurable enum mappings for a particular remote system. For bi-directional integrations enumerated value mappings should be one to one or round trip results will be inconsistent. The PK structure forces one mapped value for each enumId.

field.name: remoteAttributes
field.description: May be useful for other transports, for SFTP servers that do not support setting file attributes after put/upload set to N

field.name: sendServiceName
field.description: Override for SystemMessageType.sendServiceName

field.name: username
field.description:
Username for basic auth when sending to the remote system. This user needs permission to run the remote service or whatever on the remote system receives the message.
Note: For a Moqui remote server the user needs authz for the org.moqui.impl.SystemMessageServices.receive#IncomingSystemMessage service, ie the user should be in a group that has authz for the SystemMessageServices ArtifactGroup such as the SYSMSG_RECEIVE user group (see SecurityTypeData.xml).

field.name: password
field.description: Username for basic auth when sending to the remote system.

field.name: publicKey
field.description: Public Key for key based authentication, generally RSA PEM format

field.name: privateKey
field.description: Private Key for key based authentication, generally RSA PEM PKCS #8 format like OpenSSH

field.name: remotePublicKey
field.description: Remote System's Public Key for decryption, signature validation, etc; generally RSA PEM or X.509 Certificate format

field.name: sharedSecret
field.description: Shared secret for auth on receive and/or sign on send.

field.name: sendSharedSecret
field.description: Shared secret for auth on send if different from secret used to authorize on receive.

field.name: sendAuthEnumId
field.description: If send and receive auth mechanisms are different specify send auth method here

field.name: systemMessageTypeId
field.description: Optional. May be used when this remote is for one type of message.

field.name: internalId
field.description: Sender (outgoing) or receiver (incoming) ID (EDI: in ISA06/08; OAGIS in ApplicationArea.Sender/Receiver.ID)

field.name: internalAppCode
field.description: Application code (EDI: in GS02/03; OAGIS: in ApplicationArea.Sender/Receiver elements, split among sub-elements)

field.name: remoteId
field.description: Sender (incoming) or receiver (outgoing) ID (EDI: in ISA06/08; OAGIS in ApplicationArea.Sender/Receiver.ID)

field.name: remoteAppCode
field.description: Application code (EDI: in GS02/03; OAGIS: in ApplicationArea.Sender/Receiver elements, split among sub-elements)

field.name: ackRequested
field.description: Request acknowledgement? Possible values dependent on message standard.

field.name: usageCode
field.description: Used for production versus test/etc. Possible values dependent on message standard.

field.name: preAuthMessageRemoteId
field.description: Remote system related to this remote system but for pre-auth purposes, like a separate single sign on server

field.name: produceServiceName
field.description: Not used in automated processing, but useful for documentation and tools in some cases.

field.name: consumeServiceName
field.description: The service to call after a message is received to consume it. Should implement the org.moqui.impl.SystemMessageServices.consume#SystemMessage interface (just a systemMessageId in-parameter). Used by the consume#ReceivedSystemMessage service.

field.name: produceAckServiceName
field.description: The service to call to produce an async acknowledgement of a message. Should implement the org.moqui.impl.SystemMessageServices.produce#AckSystemMessage. Once the message is produced should call the org.moqui.impl.SystemMessageServices.queue#SystemMessage service.

field.name: sendServiceName
field.description: The service to call to send queued messages. Should implement the org.moqui.impl.SystemMessageServices.send#SystemMessage interface (just a systemMessageId in-parameter and remoteMessageId out-parameter). Used by the send#ProducedSystemMessage service, and for that service must be specified or will result in an error.

field.name: receiveServiceName
field.description: The service to call to save a received message. Should implement the org.moqui.impl.SystemMessageServices.receive#SystemMessage interface. If not specified receive#IncomingSystemMessage just saves the message directly. When applicable, used by the send service as the service on the remote server to call to receive the message.

field.name: receivePath
field.description: Where to look for files on a remote server, syntax is implementation specific

field.name: receiveFilePattern
field.description: Regular expression to match filenames in receivePath (optional)

field.name: receiveMovePath
field.description: After successful receive move file to this path if receiveResponseEnumId = MsgRrMove

field.name: sendPath
field.description: Where to put files on a remote server, syntax is implementation specific and may include both path and a filename pattern

field.name: serviceName
field.description: May be semaphore-name if that attribute is used, otherwise is service name
